snippet: A frenzied escalation of violence over the last few days is threatening a cease-fire that was supposed to build confidence for peace talks.
abstract: Yemeni citizens express doubts that country's war can be ended by negotiations between government forces and Houthi fighters, fearing that any agreement would only be prelude to uglier conflict; frenzied escalation of violence following declaration of cease-fire exacerbates concerns over conflict and its benefit to local Al Qaeda recruiters.

byline.contributor: Shuaib Almosawa contributed reporting from Taiz and from Sana, Yemen.

lead_paragraph: A frenzied escalation of violence over the last few days is threatening a cease-fire that was supposed to build confidence for peace talks.

headline.main: As War Strangles Yemen, Many Fear the Grip Will Never Break
headline.print_headline: Many Fear That War’s Grip on Yemen Will Never Break

keywords.name: organizations
keywords.value: Al Qaeda in the Arabian Peninsula
